topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Step 4 - Launching the Horizon Interface

bodydiv.p: After the Standard Region is deployed, you can launch the Horizon interface to verify that the installation was successful.

section.title: Import the Horizon browser certificate
section.p: You need to import the Horizon security certificate (ca.crt) into your browser. The ca.crt is available in the lifecycle manager in the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname> folder. You can use any file transfer program to move the certificate file from the lifecycle manager to the local system.
Use the instructions provided by the browser manufacturer to import the ca.crt file. For a list of browsers supported by OpenStack, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Horizon/BrowserSupport.
Also, clear the cache of the browser.

section.title: Login to Horizon
section.p: At this point, you can log into the Horizon interface, a web-interface you can use to manage and maintain HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. Use the CAN IP address to launch Horizon. You can locate the CAN IP address in the ~/stackrc file on any of the controller nodes in the Standard Region. The CAN IP address contains port 5000.

To access a the CAN IP:
SSH into the lifecycle manager host as the root user. The default password is cghelion.ssh root@<CLM_IP>
where: CLM_IP is located in the IP address for the lifecycle manager in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under hlm_clmstaticip field.
SSH into the lifecycle VM as the root user. The default password is cghelion.
SSH into a controller as the cghelion user. No password is required.
Change to the root user.sudo -i 5. View the stackrc file: cat ~/stackrc
section.codeblock: export OS_PASSWORD=qekuTPcc26Ig export OS_USERNAME=admin export OS_TENANT_NAME=admin export OS_AUTH_URL=https://10.20.4.120:5000/v2.0 export OS_CACERT=/etc/stunnel/ssl/hlm/certs/ca.crt export OS_REGION_NAME=tahoe unset OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME unset OS_PROJECT_NAME unset OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID unset OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION unset OS_AUTH_VERSION
section.p: In this case, the CAN IP address is located in the OS_AUTH_URL=https://10.x.x.x:5000/v2.0 line. You would log in using https://10.x.x.x.
Enter the IP in the browser to access the log-in page:https://<CAN_IP>
By default, the user name is admin. You can find the installation password for admin in the /root/stackrc file from any of the controller nodes.
